Topic: Draw two habitats and the different living things in each
Evidence Statements: The student can identify and draw two different types of habitats, one on land and one in water.
The student can draw and label different living things found in the land habitat, such as trees, grasses, bushes, and animals like lizards, squirrels, and ants.
The student can draw and label different living things found in the water habitat, such as fish, clams, and plants that grow in water.
The student can compare the different types of living things in each habitat by illustrating and labeling them.
The student can show patterns in plant and animal diversity across the two habitats through their drawings.
